meanings.definition: The act of including something within a larger category or group.
meanings.sent1: The subsumption of fruits under the category of food is essential for a balanced diet.
meanings.sent2: In biology, the subsumption of mammals under the class of vertebrates is well-known.
meanings.sent3: The subsumption of socks under the drawer caused a funny mix-up in the laundry.
meanings.sent4: Her subsumption of all expenses under 'miscellaneous' was a clever way to simplify budgeting.
meanings.sent5: The subsumption of all planets under the solar system makes it easier to study astronomy.

meanings.definition: The process of absorbing or incorporating something into a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The subsumption of new data into the report improved its accuracy.
meanings.sent2: During digestion, the subsumption of nutrients into the bloodstream occurs.
meanings.sent3: The subsumption of ideas from different sources led to a creative breakthrough.
meanings.sent4: His subsumption of various melodies into one song created a unique piece of music.
meanings.sent5: The subsumption of individual voices into a choir creates a harmonious blend of sound.
